sn2.6:4.2: Standing to one side, the god Kāmada said to the Buddha:
sn2.6:4.3: ‘It’s too hard, Blessed One! It’s just too hard!”
sn2.6:5.1: “They do it even though it’s hard,” said the Buddha to Kāmada,
sn2.6:5.2: “the stable trainees with ethics, and samādhi.
sn2.6:5.3: For one who has entered the homeless life,
sn2.6:6.1: “Such contentment, Blessed One, is hard to find.”
sn2.6:7.1: “They find it even though it’s hard,” said the Buddha to Kāmada,
sn2.6:8.1: “But this mind, Blessed One, is hard to converge in samādhi.”
sn2.6:9.1: “They converge in samādhi even though it’s hard,” said the Buddha to Kāmada,
sn2.6:9.3: Having cut through the net of Death,
sn2.6:9.4: the noble ones, Kāmada, go on their way.”
sn2.6:10.1: “But this path, Blessed One, is rough and hard to travel.”
sn2.6:11.2: the noble ones, Kāmada, go on their way.
sn2.6:11.5: But the path of the noble ones is smooth,
sn2.6:11.6: for the noble ones are smooth amid the rough.”
